author: Michael Larabel
description: The GNOME 49 release candidate "49.rc" was just released as we close in on the stable GNOME 49.0 release in two weeks...
title: GNOME 49 Release Candidate Ships With GDM Re-Enabling X11 Support By Default

author: Michael Larabel
description: Well, here is some sad news... After the better part of two decades at Red Hat, Hans de Goede shared today he will be leaving the company next month. Hans de Goede during his time at Red Hat has been responsible for countless hardware improvements especially for Linux laptops, serves as the x86 platform subsystem lead maintainer for the Linux kernel, and has done immense work over the past 17 years for bettering Linux hardware support especially on consumer devices...
title: Linux Hardware Enablement Leader Hans de Goede Leaving Red Hat

author: Michael Larabel
description: SUSE's Lubos Kocman announced today on the behalf of the openSUSE team that they will be providing extended maintenance updates and community support with the upcoming Leap 16 release...
title: openSUSE Leap 16 To Provide 24 Months Of Maintenance Updates / Community Support

author: Michael Larabel
description: The Rust Foundation today announced the creation of the Rust Innovation Lab that will serve as a stable, neutral home to select Rust projects with governance support, legal and administrative support, fiscal sponsorship, and more...
title: Rust Innovation Lab Announced By The Rust Foundation

author: Michael Larabel
description: Ahead of the upcoming Linux 6.18 kernel cycle, which will likely end up being this year's Long Term Support (LTS) version, the AMD Secure AVIC driver appears ready for merging. The AMD Secure AVIC patches were queued this week into a TIP branch and this likely to be submitted for the upcoming Linux 6.18 merge window...
title: AMD Secure AVIC Primed For Linux 6.18 To Provide Better Security & Performance

author: Michael Larabel
description: Niri 25.08 is out this week as the newest version of this scrollable-tiling Wayland compositor. Notable now is adding xwayland-satellite integration for offering legacy X11 app support...
title: Niri 25.08 Wayland Compositor Introduces xwayland-satellite Support

author: Michael Larabel
description: Intel announced the Arc Pro B-Series back at Computex consisting of the Arc Pro B50 and Arc Pro B60 graphics cards. Marking availability today and the review embargo lift is for the Arc Pro B50 for workstations, which provides 16GB of RAM, 70 Watt total board power, and a $349 USD launch price for this workstation graphics card. Here are the preliminary Linux performance benchmarks and open-source driver support metrics for the Intel Arc Pro B50.
title: Intel Arc Pro B50 Linux Performance Benchmarks

author: Michael Larabel
description: Mesa 25.2.2 is out today as another on-time, bi-weekly Mesa point release managed by Eric Engestrom...
title: Mesa 25.2.2 Ships The Latest Open-Source OpenGL & Vulkan Driver Fixes

author: Michael Larabel
description: One of the planned changes for Fedora 43 was setting an expectation that RPM package builds are reproducible. Much of Fedora's "reproducible builds" effort is already complete but this change has now been deferred to the Fedora 44 release next year...
title: Fedora's Reproducible Package Build Mandate Deferred To F44

author: Michael Larabel
description: A patch series for the Linux kernel scheduler code is queued up for expected introduction in Linux 6.18 to defer throttle when tasks exit to user-space. These changes to switch the scheduler to a task-based throttle model and task-based throttle time accounting can provide a latency win and also address a possible deadlock situation for real-time "RT" kernels...
title: Linux Scheduler Adapted For A Latency Win & Avoiding An RT Deadlock
